post_text: The MHSAA Women In Sports Leadership Conference is the first, largest and longest-running conference of its type in the country. The conference is designed for those interested in becoming a high school coach, administrator, official or athletic trainer and is held in Lansing every other year. The girls attended sessions in Mindful Living for Mindful Leadership. They also listened to speakers which included Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson and Michigan State Volleyball Coach Cathy George.

Hudson Area Schools Alumni Association
January 21 at 11:40 AM ¬∑

Hudson's winningest coach, Coach Chris Luma, Class of 1977, has announced his retirement. Chris was quarterback during Hudson's legendary football Streak where the Mighty Tigers won 72 straight games between 1968-1976. He began coaching in 1982, and became head coach in 1997. Over the course of his outstanding 22 years as head coach, Hudson's win-loss record was 180-70, including 5 undefeated regular seasons. He led our team to 13 LCAA titles, 5 regional championships, and the state championship in 2010. With a record like that, it is no surprise that he was inducted into the Michigan High School Football Hall of Fame in 2017. Congratulations Coach Luma on an amazing career!
